metadata.synopsis: Non-critpath. Takes place after the player resolves the confronation between this adventurer and the thiefling boy who stole the adventurer's necklace.

8.speaker: Barth
8.text: Good to be back behind the walls, have to say. For as long as that lasts.

26.speaker: Barth
26.text: Not in the mood to talk right now. It ain't you, so leave it.

47.speaker: Barth
47.text: Hey. Thanks for stepping between me and the kid.

81.speaker: Barth
81.text: My mum gave me that amulet. But I think she'd be happy knowing the kid has it now.

62.speaker: Barth
62.text: Thanks to you, I almost lost my locket. My mum gave that to me on her deathbed.

130.speaker: Barth
130.text: Get out of my face. Got nothing to say to you.

64.speaker: Barth
64.text: Watch your bags, huh? Learn from my mistakes.

65.speaker: Barth
65.text: I'll say this for those devils: they know how to throw a punch.

110.speaker: Barth
110.text: Can't believe the kid thought he could snatch my mum's locket and get away with it.

9.speaker: Barth
9.text: Bet he's learned his lesson now.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Speaking of the locket... can I have it?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Quit whining, and give me the locket. It'll save me the effort of picking your pocket later.

21.speaker: Barth
21.text: Tell me you are, and this doesn't have to end in blood.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Blood? Sounds like a happy ending to me.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: If you don't want another beating, give me the locket. Now.

15.speaker: Barth
15.text: My mum gave me that locket on her godsdamned deathbed. The boy took the thing. I know it.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: You mean this locket? How much is it worth to you?

122.speaker: Barth
122.text: How did you... all right, fine. I'll give you some coin for it.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Forget the coin. The locket's yours. Take it.

98.speaker: Barth
98.text: I... I don't know what to say.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: On second thought, I quite like this bauble. Think I'll keep it for myself.

49.speaker: Barth
49.text: It's gonna be hard to wear a necklace when you ain't got a neck. Give it back.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: 'Some coin'? Try 'lots of coin' - or else the trinket stays with me.

38.speaker: Barth
38.text: Fine. I'll give you everything I've got and you can choke on it for all I care. Give me the amulet.

111.speaker: Barth
111.text: Fine. I'll give you everything I've got and you can choke on it for all I care. Give me the amulet.

7.speaker: Barth
7.text: And here's your reward. We're square now. Get lost.

88.speaker: Barth
88.text: And it looks like someone took my money too. Got nothing to give you but my thanks.

67.speaker: Barth
67.text: If that ain't enough, too bad. It's all I got.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: On second thoughts, I'm keeping it.

32.text: Don't blame you for trying, but I gotta eat. Give me the amulet, I pay you fair, and we're square.

5.speaker: Barth
5.text: Don't blame you for trying, but I gotta eat. Give me the amulet, I pay you fair, and we're square.

80.speaker: Barth
80.text: Now hand it over, or we're gonna have problems, you and me.

28.speaker: Barth
28.text: And here's your reward. We're square now. Get lost.

48.speaker: Barth
48.text: And it looks like someone took my money too. Got nothing to give you but my thanks.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Then I guess we're going to have problems. Because I'm keeping it.

61.speaker: Barth
61.text: That's it. That is bloody it.

37.speaker: Barth
37.text: It's the last thing of mum's I have... it's worth everything to me.

42.speaker: Barth
42.text: It's the last thing of mum's I have... it's worth everything to me.

66.speaker: Barth
66.text: What're you waiting for? I told you I'd give you some coin. Hand it over!

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I think you can up your offer a little. It was a gift from your mother, after all.

97.text: W-what? Get your head outta my head!

52.speaker: Barth
52.text: W-what? Get your head outta my head!

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Here's the locket. It's all yours.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives amulet to Barth

121.speaker: Barth
121.text: You found it? I... I don't know what to say.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Taking locket. NodeContext: Gruff, edge of tears.

114.speaker: Barth
114.text: I know it's stupid. It's all I have of her, is all.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down at the locket. NodeContext: Gruff, edge of tears.

127.speaker: Barth
127.text: Kind of you, friend. Here's something for your troubles.
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Handing over reward. NodeContext: Snuffling.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Heirloom, is it? Been in your family long?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Not much of an heirloom then... unless there's a tale behind it, maybe?

44.speaker: Barth
44.text: She stole it from a house she cleaned, all right?

91.speaker: Barth
91.text: She stole it from a house she cleaned, all right?

16.speaker: Barth
16.text: They didn't pay her much. They owed her a perk or two.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Let me get this straight - you're annoyed that somebody stole your stolen property?

13.speaker: Barth
13.text: Ain't the same and you know it.

100.speaker: Barth
100.text: Anyway, I meant what I said. Thanks for what you did. I gotta go.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Wherever it came from, at least it's something to remember her by.

53.speaker: Barth
53.text: Anyway, I should go. See you around.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I see. Your blessed mum was providing for her family, but the young tiefling is a thieving devil.

126.speaker: Barth
126.text: Never said she was an angel, did I? But she sure as hells didn't have horns on her head!

124.text: Nothing. I'm sad, is all. Leave it alone.

74.speaker: Barth
74.text: Nothing. I'm sad, is all. Leave it alone.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Well, at least you can have it back now.

82.speaker: Barth
82.text: Was in another family right up 'til mum stole it. But it's mine now - all I have.

112.speaker: Barth
112.text: Was in another family right up 'til mum stole it. But it's mine now - all I have.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Let me guess - it wasn't your mother's to give you in the first place, was it?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Come on, spit it out. What aren't you telling me about the locket?

59.text: Ugh. Get your head outta my head!

3.speaker: Barth
3.text: Ugh. Get your head outta my head!

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I'll see about getting it back into your hands.

25.speaker: Barth
25.text: Kind of you to offer, but that boy ain't giving it up, not even to one of his own. I'm sure of it.

108.speaker: Barth
108.text: And if you twist the pup's arm, he'll yelp, and the wolves'll come running.

104.speaker: Barth
104.text: Should've seen that, but my temper was up.

69.speaker: Barth
69.text: I appreciate the kindness friend, but I ain't getting the locket back. Not now.

36.speaker: Barth
36.text: Kind of you to offer, but that boy ain't giving it up. I'm sure of it.

68.speaker: Barth
68.text: The nerve of that smirking little rat.

71.speaker: Barth
71.text: That kid stole the one thing that means anything to me.

85.speaker: Barth
85.text: Got a beating, thanks to you. But at least I got my locket back.

86.speaker: Barth
86.text: Someone stole the damn amulet off me again. Don't want to talk about it.

87.speaker: Barth
87.text: Thanks to you, that kid has my locket. My mum gave that to me on her deathbed.

90.speaker: Barth
90.text: Thanks to you, that kid has my mum's locket and I got a beating.

12.speaker: Barth
12.text: Got nothing to say to you. You got nothing I want.

95.speaker: Barth
95.text: You're all right by me, friend.

129.speaker: Barth
129.text: I'll say this for you devils: you know how to throw a punch.

131.speaker: Barth
131.text: Get out of my face. Got nothing to say to you.
